alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 12:41PM EDT until August 30 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Brooks County in south central Georgia... Lowndes County in south central Georgia... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 1241 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated earlier heavy rains produced between 4 and 9 inches of rainn. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding will gradually recede through early this afternoon. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Valdosta, Lake Park, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Dasher, Valdosta Regional Airport, I-75 At Exit 11, Kinderlou, Clyattville, Twin Lakes, I-75 At Exit 5, Barretts, Naylor and Nankin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
